tours.titre: 10 DAYS MOROCCO GRAND TOUR FROM MARRAKECH

about.paragraph1: Morocco 10 days grand tour from Marrakech and Essaouira to Fes and Chefchaouen through the Sahara desert. In these 10 days / 9 nights visit so many amazing sites. Including : the Highlights of Marrakech and Essaouira, the high Atlas mountains and the Tizi-n-tichka pass. As well as visiting the Ait-Ben-Haddou Kasbah, dades valley and Todra gorges. Also visit Merzouga Sahara desert. Where you ride camels, witness magical sunset and sunrise and spend the night in a desert camp. Also explore the Sahara desert of Merzouga in a 4x4 car.
about.paragraph2: Furthermore you will visit the Rissani traditional market, and Erfoud the fossils town. Then visit the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane, and the cedars forest where the Barbary macaques live. Explore Fes and Meknes two of the imperial cities of Morocco. Visit the Roman ruins of Volubilis and the blue city of Chefchaouen. Finally, the tour ends in Tangier.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 10 DAYS TOUR OF MARRAKECH

jours.jour: 1st day : Arrival to Marrakech( 15 Min Drive )
text: The 10 day Morocco trip begins with a pickup from Marrakech airport, followed by a brief drive through the city of Marrakech. Afterward, you'll be transferred to your accommodation for an overnight stay in a traditional riad.

jours.jour: 2ed day : Arrival to Marrakech( 3 hours Drive )
text: After breakfast, we head west toward the coastal city of Essaouira. Along the way, we'll stop to visit an Argan tree plantation and a local cooperative. If you're lucky, you might even spot goats climbing the trees! We'll also pause for panoramic views before arriving in Essaouira-formerly known as Mogador-one of Morocco's most charming coastal towns. Enjoy free time to explore the fishing port, stroll along the ancient ramparts lined with cannons, and wander through the atmospheric old medina. Overnight stay in Essaouira.

jours.jour: 3rd day : Essaouira-guided Tour sightseeing Marrakech( 3 hours Drive + 3 hours walking Tour )
text: We return to Marrakech to discover the city's most iconic landmarks with a local guide. As one of Morocco's historic imperial cities, Marrakech is rich in culture and architectural beauty. The tour includes a visit to the stunning 19th-century Bahia Palace, followed by the beautifully preserved Ben Youssef Madrasa, a former Islamic school showcasing traditional Moroccan design. You'll also explore the lively Medina and its souks, filled with colorful stalls and skilled artisans, experience the vibrant atmosphere of Jamaa El Fna Square, and admire the grandeur of the Koutoubia Mosque, the largest in the city.

jours.jour: 4th day : Marrakech - High Atlas Mountains - Ait Ben Haddou- Roses Vally- Dades Valley( 6 hours Drive )
text: Drive through the fascinating High Atlas mountains, and Tizi-N-Tichka, pass. Stops will be made for panoramic views of the breathtaking landscapes and Berber Villages.

Our next stop is the renowned Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou, a fortified village and UNESCO World Heritage Site. This iconic site has served as the backdrop for numerous films, including Gladiator, Alexander, The Mummy, and popular TV series like Game of Thrones. 40-minute hike to explore the kasbah on foot and enjoy panoramic views from the top.Then we head to 'The gate of the desert' Ouarzazate. Free time for lunch, then we continue to visit the Rose valley passing through the large palm grove of Skoura. Finally we drive to Boumalne Dades where we spend the night. ( Dinner Included)

jours.jour: 5th day : Dades Valley - Todra Gorges - Merzouga Dunes - Camel trekking - overnight in a luxury camp ( 5 hours Drive )
text: After breakfast, we drive through the scenic Dades Valley, making a stop at a panoramic viewpoint. We then continue to the spectacular Todra Gorges, where the Todra River has carved a dramatic canyon with towering red cliffs. You'll have free time to walk through the gorge and enjoy the natural beauty of this unique setting.
The journey then takes us through the lush palm groves of Touroug and Tinjdad, with free time for lunch along the way.

In the afternoon, we arrive in the golden dunes of the Merzouga Sahara Desert, where your camels await. Embark on a peaceful camel trek across the dunes, with a stop atop a high dune to witness the magical desert sunset. You'll then continue to a luxury desert camp, where you'll be welcomed with traditional Berber hospitality. Enjoy dinner, accompanied by Berber drumming and dancing around the campfire. Overnight stay in the camp.

jours.jour: 6th day : Explore Merzouga region - Nomads - Khamlia - Merzouga lake - Erg Chebbi - Palm Grove ( 2 hours Drive )
text: Wake up early in the morning is a must do, in order to contemplate the beautiful sunrise, in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast. Then you return on camels or a 4x4 ride to Merzouga, where the driver awaits. We dedicate the day to explore the region of Merzouga. The area has so many incredible sites, from sand dunes, wild lake, mines, fossils areas to fabulous oases. Which are ideal places for so many outdoor activities.

Firstly, we start our journey in Merzouga, by driving off-road to visit an ancient eyeliner mine. Then we pay the nomads a visit, in their handmade woven tent. Learn how they live while drinking a Berber tea. Our next destination is the Khamlia village, where you will enjoy the Gnaoua music, and dancing performances. Its inhabitants are originating from sub-Saharan countries like Mali, Sudan and Niger. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. After that we take a stroll in a palm trees grove. Then drive a few kilometres to see the wild lake of Merzouga, also called flamingos lake. Dinner and overnight in a Riad next to the dunes.

jours.jour: 7th day : Merzouga Dunes - Erfoud - Medelt - Cedars forest - Ifrane - Fes ( 7 hours Drive )
text: After breakfast, we leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani still a major trading center in the region, with a large souk lively on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays. After a stroll in Rissani souk, we continue to Erfoud where we visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble.

After that we drive along the Ziz river, we stop for a panoramic view of the Ziz valley. Free time for lunch in Midelt or on the way. Then we continue to cedars forest, where the Barbary Macaques live. Feel free to feed them while wandering in the forest. After that we visit Ifrane, famous for its low temperature, snow and the alpine-style houses -No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. Finally, night in Fes, free evening in the Medina.

jours.jour: 8th day : Guided tour sightseeing Fes ( 30 Min / 3h to 4h walking Tour)
text: We'll pick you up from your accommodation in Fes after breakfast to begin your immersive exploration of one of Morocco's most iconic imperial cities, the country's cultural and spiritual heart.

Your journey starts with a driving tour. First, we'll stop at the magnificent Royal Palace Gate, followed by a visit to 'The Mellah', the historic Jewish Quarter. Then, enjoy breathtaking views from the Borj Sud fortress, offering a stunning overlook of the ancient Medina. The final stop of this portion is the Ceramic Village & School, where you'll witness traditional craftsmanship in action.

Next, a walking tour, step back in time as you enter the medieval Medina, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the best-preserved historic towns in the Arab world. Accompanied by a knowledgeable local guide, you'll explore highlights such as the Al Attarine Madrasa, the University and Mosque of Al Quaraouiyine considered the oldest existing university in the world and the colorful Chouara Tanneries, where leather is dyed using centuries-old methods.
After this unforgettable journey through history, you'll be returned to your riad to relax.

jours.jour: 9th day : Fes - Meknes - Volubilis ruins - Chefchaouen ( 4 hours Drive )
text: After breakfast, we depart to visit Meknes, the Ismaili capital and one of the imperial cities. In which we visit: Bab Al-Mansour, Sahrij Souani basin, the Royal stables, the granary and the Moulay Ismail Mausoleum. Free time for lunch. Next we drive 30 km away from Meknes to visit the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis. It is well preserved, as it is recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. It has many beautiful mosaics scattered here and there, along with ancient pillars and archways.

After exploring the ancient ruins, we continue our journey north through Ouazzane, making our way to Chefchaouen, nestled in the Rif Mountains. Often referred to as the Blue City, Chefchaouen is renowned for its charming streets and buildings painted in various shades of blue. You'll have the evening to relax and soak in the town's unique atmosphere. Overnight stay in a local Riad.

jours.jour: 10th day : Transfer to Tangier Airport ( 2 hours Drive )
text: After breakfast, we drive through the scenic Rif Mountains en route to Tangier Airport, marking the end of your unforgettable 10 day trip from Marrakech.
Depending on your flight time-you may enjoy some free time to wander through the charming blue-painted alleyways of Chefchaouen or even take a short city tour in Tangier.

tours.to: 12 days Morocco Tour itinerary from Casablanca
tours.titre: 12 DAYS MOROCCO TOUR ITINERARY FROM CASABLANCA

about.paragraph1: Morocco 12 day tour from Casablanca. In these 12 days /11 nights, you will visit the four imperial cities and the Sahara desert. Starting the tour from north Morocco, visiting the city of Casablanca. Then Rabat the capital of Morocco, and Chefchaouen the blue city. In addition to the Roman ruins of Volubilis, Meknes the Ismaili capital, and Fes the cultural city. Then we head south, visiting the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane, and also the cedars forest. As well as visiting Midelt, the Ziz valley, Rissani traditional market and Erfoud the fossils town.
about.paragraph2: Furthermore, you will visit the Sahara desert of Merzouga. In which you will ride camels, spend the night in a camp in the middle of the desert. Enjoy magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara. Also visit the Todra and Dades gorges, the Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. Moreover, you will cross the High Atlas mountains and the Tizi-n-Tichka pass. Finally, guided tour in Marrakech and Essaouira cities. The 12 day tour ends in Casablanca.

programme.soustitre: 12 DAYS IN MOROCCO | TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

jours.jour: 1st Day: Arrival to Casablanca - Visit The Largest City Of Morocco (1 Hours Drive)
text: On the first day of your 12 Days in Morocco, we'll welcome you upon arrival at the airport or directly from your accommodation in Casablanca - Morocco's largest city and economic heartbeat. Your journey begins with a visit to the spectacular Hassan II Mosque, perched on a promontory overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. As the largest mosque in Morocco, its intricate architecture and seaside setting make it a must-see landmark.
After some free time for lunch, we continue exploring the highlights of Casablanca. Depending on your arrival time, the tour may include:
liste: Mohammed V Square - the bustling dric center known for its colonial architecture
A photo stop at the iconic Rick's Cafe, inspired by the classic film Casablanca
A scenic walk along the vibrant Corniche of Casablanca
jours.note: Note: The order and number of visits may vary based on your arrival schedule. Overnight stay in a comfortable hotel in Casablanca.

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Casablanca - Rabat the capital - Chefchaouen (5 hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we drive along the coastline to Rabat, one of the imperial cities in Morocco and the current capital. It is located in northwestern Morocco. You will visit the highlights of the Moroccan capital, including: Hassan tower, The Mausoleum of Mohammed V and The Kasbah of Oudaya. Free time for lunch. In the afternoon we head north through Ouazzane, to reach the Blue city of Chefchaouen in the Rif Mountains. Overnight stay in a hotel.

jours.jour: 3rd Day: Sightseeing Chefchaouen the blue city (No Driving - 2 Hours walking Tour)
text: After breakfast, we will explore Chefchaouen, the blue city. Also known as Achaoun, which means horns in Berber. The city is located in the Rif mountains northwest Morocco. It is famous for its buildings and alleyways painted in white and blue. Firstly we will stroll in its charming old Medina, which has so many beautiful authentic blue doors and whitewashed walls. Free time for lunch. In the afternoon you can hike to the Spanish mosque located on a high ground, where you can see the spectacular view of the whole blue city. Finally, return to your hotel.

jours.jour: 4th Day: Chefchaouen - The Roman Ruins of Wolubilis - Meknes - Fes (4 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, feel free to wander in the beautiful alleyways of the blue city Chefchaouen. Then we drive to visit the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis, well preserved and recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It has many beautiful mosaics, ancient pillars and archways. After strolling in the ruins, we drive 30 km to visit Meknes, the Ismaili capital and one of the imperial cities, where we visit Bab Al-Mansour, Sahrij Souani basin, the Royal stables, the granary and the Moulay Ismail Mausoleum. Then we head to Fes for an overnight stay in a Riad.

jours.jour: 5th Day: Sightseeing Fes with a Local Guide (30 min Drive / 3 Hours To 4 Hours walking Tour)
text: We'll pick you up from your Riad in Fes after breakfast to begin your immersive exploration of one of Morocco's most iconic imperial cities. Fes is the country's cultural and spiritual heart.

Your journey starts with a driving tour. First, we'll stop at the magnificent Royal Palace Gate, followed by a visit to 'The Mellah', the historic Jewish Quarter. Then, enjoy breathtaking views from the Borj Sud fortress, offering a stunning overlook of the ancient Medina. The final stop is the Ceramic Village & School, where you'll witness traditional craftsmanship in action.

Next, a walking tour: step back in time as you enter the medieval Medina, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the best-preserved historic towns in the Arab world. Highlights include the Al Attarine Madrasa, the University and Mosque of Al Quaraouiyine, and the colorful Chouara Tanneries, where leather is dyed using centuries-old methods.
After this unforgettable journey through history, you'll be returned to your Riad to relax.

jours.jour: 6th Day: Fes - Ifrane - Cedars forest - Midelt - Ziz valley - Merzouga Sahara (7 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we drive south through Imouzzer to visit Ifrane, famous for its low temperature, snow, and alpine-style architecture houses. Known as the Switzerland of Morocco. Then we continue to the cedars forest, home to Barbary macaques. Later, we continue to Midelt for lunch.

We then drive to Merzouga through the Tizi-n-Tilghmt pass along the Ziz valley, with stops for panoramic views. In the afternoon, we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga, switch to camels, climb a high dune to enjoy the sunset, and continue to the camp for dinner and overnight stay.

jours.jour: 7th Day: Explore Merzouga region - Nomads - Khamlia - Merzuga lake - Erg Chebbi - palm grove (2 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early to witness the sunrise in the desert. Free time for breakfast. Return by camels or 4x4 ride to Merzouga. Explore Merzouga region, visiting sand dunes, wild lake, oases, and fossil areas.

Visit an ancient eyeliner mine, meet nomads in their woven tents, learn about their lifestyle, enjoy Berber tea, then visit Khamlia village for Gnaoua music and dancing. Walk through the palm trees grove and see the Merzouga flamingos lake. Return to Merzouga for dinner and overnight stay in a hotel.

jours.jour: 8th Day: Merzouga Sahara - Rissani - Erfoud - Todra Gorges - Dades Valley (5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, leave the desert to visit Rissani, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Explore the Rissani souk. Then continue to Erfoud to visit fossilized marble workshops.
Drive through Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves, then visit the Todra Gorges, a red cliff canyon. Finally, continue to the Dades Valley for dinner and overnight stay in a hotel.

jours.jour: 9th Day: Dades Valley - Roses Valley - Palm Groves of Skoura - Ouarzazate Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah - High Atlas Mountains - Marrakech (5.5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, visit Kalaa Magouna for the Rose valley and the annual Rose Festival. Continue through the palm groves of Skoura to Ouarzazate, visiting film studios.
Visit the Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou, a UNESCO World Heritage Site featured in many movies. Drive through the High Atlas Mountains and Tizi-N-Tichka pass to Marrakech. Overnight stay in a Riad.

jours.jour: 10th Day: Guided Tour sightseeing Marrakesh (45 Min Drive / 3 Hours Walking Tour)
text: After breakfast, explore Marrakech highlights with a local guide. Visit Bahia Palace, Ben Youssef Madrasa, Jamaa El Fna Square, and Koutoubia Mosque. Free time for lunch. Visit Majorelle Garden and Gueliz district before returning to the Riad.

jours.jour: 11th Day: Marrakech - Essaouira (3 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, drive west to Essaouira, stopping at Argan tree plantations and cooperatives. Visit the fishing port, ancient ramparts, and the old Medina. Overnight stay in Essaouira.

jours.jour: 12th Day: Arrival to Marrakech (4 Hours 20 Min Drive)
text: Depart from Essaouira to Casablanca airport. End the 12 days Morocco Tour in Marrakech.

tours.titre: BEST 7 DAYS IN MOROCCO TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

As well as visiting Midelt, the amazing Ziz valley, Rissani traditional market and Erfoud the fossils town.
about.paragraph2: Furthermore, you will visit the Sahara desert of Merzouga. In which you will ride camels, spend the night in a luxury camp in the middle of the desert. Enjoy magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara. Also visit the Todra and Dades gorges, and the Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. Moreover, you will cross the High Atlas mountains and the Tizi-n-Tichka pass. The 7 day Tour ends in Marrakech Late Afternoon.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY: 7 DAYS TOUR FROM CASABLANCA

jours.jour: 1st Day: Arrival to Casablanca - Visit The Largest City Of Morocco (1 Hours Drive)
text: On the first day of your 7 Days in Morocco, we'll welcome you upon arrival at the airport or directly from your accommodation in Casablanca - Morocco's largest city and economic heartbeat. Your journey begins with a visit to the spectacular Hassan II Mosque, perched on a promontory overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. As the largest mosque in Morocco, its intricate architecture and seaside setting make it a must-see landmark.
After some free time for lunch, we continue exploring the highlights of Casablanca. Depending on your arrival time, the tour may include:
liste: Mohammed V Square - the bustling civic center known for its colonial architecture
A photo stop at the iconic Rick's Café, inspired by the classic film Casablanca
A scenic walk along the vibrant Corniche of Casablanca
jours.note: Note :the order and number of visits may vary based on your arrieved schedule. Overnight stay in a comfortable hotel in Casablanca.

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Casablanca - Rabat the capital - Chefchaouen (5.5 hours drive)
text: After breakfast, we drive along the coastline to Rabat. The city is one of the imperial cities in Morocco, and the current capital. It is located on the northwest of Morocco. You will visit the highlights of the city including: the Hassan tower, the Mausoleum of Mohammed V, and also the Kasbah of Oudaya. Free time for lunch. In the afternoon we head north through Ouazzane to reach the Blue city of Chefchaouen. The city is located in the Rif Mountains, famous for its buildings and alleyways painted in blue. Finally, Overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 3rd day: Chefchaouen- The Roman Ruins of Volubilis- Meknes - Fes (4 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, feel free to wander in the beautiful alleyways of the blue city Chefchaouen. Then we drive to visit the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis. It is well preserved, as it is recognized as a World Heritage Site by the UNESCO. It has many beautiful mosaics scattered here and there, along with ancient pillars and archways. After strolling in the ruins, we drive 30 km to visit Meknes. The city is considered the Ismaili capital and one of the imperial cities, including Bab Al-Mansour, Sahrij Souani basin, the Royal stables, the granary, and also the Moulay Ismail Mausoleum. Then we head to Fes. Overnight stay in a Riad.

jours.jour: 4th Day: Sightseeing Fes with a Local Guide (30 min Drive/3hrs to 4hrs walking Tour)
text: We'll pick you up from your Riad in Fes after breakfast to begin your immersive exploration of one of Morocco's most iconic imperial cities-Fes, the country's cultural and spiritual heart.

Your journey starts with a driving tour. First, we'll stop at the magnificent Royal Palace Gate, followed by a visit to 'The Mellah', the historic Jewish Quarter. Then, enjoy breathtaking views from the Borj Sud fortress, offering a stunning overlook of the ancient Medina. The final stop of this portion is the Ceramic Village & School, where you'll witness traditional craftsmanship in action.

Next, a walking Tour, step back in time as you enter the medieval Medina, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the best-preserved historic towns in the Arab world. Accompanied by a knowledgeable local guide, you'll explore highlights such as the Al Attarine Madrasa, the University and Mosque of Al Quaraouiyine, and the colorful Chouara Tanneries, where leather is dyed using centuries-old methods.
After this unforgettable journey through history, you'll be returned to your Riad to relax.

jours.jour: 5th Day: Fes - Ifrane - Cedars forest-Midelt - Ziz valley - Merzouga Sahara (7 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we drive south through Imouzzer to visit Ifrane. The city is famous for its low temperature, snow, and alpine-style architecture houses. No wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. After that, we continue to cedars forest, where the Barbary macaques live. Feel free to feed them while wandering in the forest. Later, we continue to Midelt, where we will have free time for lunch. Then we drive to Merzouga through the Tizi-n-Tilghmt pass and along the Ziz valley with stops for panoramic views.

In the afternoon, we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga, where you switch to camels and cross the sandy desert. You will make a stop on top of a high dune to enjoy the sunset. Finally, you continue to the camp, which combines traditional tents of nomads and luxury hotel features. Enjoy Berber drums music while dancing around the campfire under a vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp.

jours.jour: 6th day: Merzouga Sahara - Rissani - Erfoud - Todra Gorges - Dades Valley (5 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early to contemplate the beautiful sunrise in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast. Then return on camels or the camp's 4x4 to Merzouga where the driver awaits. Then we leave the desert to visit Rissani, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani remains a major trading center in the region with a large souk lively 3 days a week.

After a stroll in Rissani souk, we continue to Erfoud to visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble. Then we drive through Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves to reach the Todra Gorges. The Todra river has carved a grand canyon through the mountains. These gorges are ideal for rock climbers. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. Then continue to the Dades valley, through Boumalne Dades, with stops at 'monkey fingers' rock formation and a spot overlooking the valley. Dinner and overnight in a Riad.

jours.jour: 7th Day: Dades Valley - Roses Town - Palm Groves of Skoura - Ouarzazate - Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah - High Atlas Mountains - Marrakech (6 Hours Drive)
text: On the last day, we continue our trip to Kalaa Magouna to visit the Rose valley & a Cooperative. A Rose Festival is held annually in May where locals offer their rose products, from perfumes, rose water, oil to cosmetic products. Then we drive through the palm groves of Skoura to reach Ouarzazate and visit Atlas Studios where famous movies were shot.

Thereafter we visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou, a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. It has appeared in many movies including Gladiator, Alexander, The Mummy and TV series like Game Of Thrones. Then we continue to Marrakech, driving through the Tizi-N-Tichka pass and the High Atlas Mountains. Stops for lunch and photo opportunities. Finally, arrive at Marrakech, then transfer to the airport or your accommodation. End of the 7 day Morocco tour.

includes: 7 Days Private Transportation in a 4x4 or Minivan with A/C + Fuel.
Private Driver Speaking English.
Walking Tour in Fes with a Local Guide.
Nights in Excellent Hotels / Riads.
Night in A Luxury Desert Camp, with Private Bathrooms.
Camel ride (Camel Per person), or a transfer via a 4WD as an alternative.
Sand boards Available at The Camp.
Pick up from Any location in Casablanca (Airport, your Hotel...etc).
Drop Off at your Accommodation in Marrakech.
2 Dinners in the Camp & Dades Valley.
Daily Breakfasts.

important.text: Bear in mind that 7 Days trip is just a tour itinerary suggestion, if it does not match what you are looking for, please do not hesitate to contact us. We will organize a different itinerary based on your preferences and your stay duration. We offer customized and tailor-made tours and trips all around Morocco.

listes.name: Laura M. – USA
listes.comment: The 7-day Morocco tour was absolutely perfect! Our driver Youssef was kind, funny, and very knowledgeable. Chefchaouen and the Sahara night were unforgettable. Everything was well organized from start to finish!

listes.name: Amine B. – France
listes.comment: Super expérience ! Les hébergements étaient très confortables surtout le camp de luxe à Merzouga. Le timing était parfait et nous avons découvert tellement de paysages différents en seulement une semaine.

listes.name: Sophie & Marc – Canada
listes.comment: Nous avons adoré la visite guidée de Fès et le désert. Le coucher de soleil dans les dunes restera un souvenir magique. Le chauffeur parlait très bien anglais et était très attentionné.

listes.name: David R. – UK
listes.comment: Great itinerary for 7 days in Morocco. Very smooth logistics, good hotels and amazing food. We especially enjoyed Ait Ben Haddou and the High Atlas drive. Highly recommended.

listes.name: Chiara P. – Italy
listes.comment: Un viaggio meraviglioso! Ogni giorno una nuova scoperta: Fes, il deserto, le gole del Todra… tutto organizzato alla perfezione. Tornerò sicuramente in Marocco!

listes.question: Is The 7 Days Morocco Tour Private Or Shared ?
listes.repense: The seven-day tour is a private experience, ensuring that only the travelers making the inquiry will be participating. No additional individuals will join the tour. Our primary focus is on providing high-quality, personalized experiences, which is why we mainly offer private tours.

listes.question: What Is The Best Time To Visit Morocco  ?
text: The best times to visit are spring (March-May) and autumn (September-November), when the weather is mild and pleasant across most regions.
Winter time is great as well, especially in the southern / Desert Part.

listes.question: Tour  Age  Suitabaility ?
listes.repense: This 7-day tour is suitable for individuals of all ages. However, please note that the tour involves approximately 1 to 7 hours of driving each day. While our vehicles are new and comfortable, and we make regular stops along the way, if you are not used to this level of travel, you may wish to consider a longer or customized tour.

listes.question: What Type Of Vehicles Are Used ?
listes.repense: The vehicle will be either an SUV (4x4) or a minivan, both with air conditioning. Vehicle Details:
listeRep: Minivans: Mercedes Vito Tourer, Ford Tourneo Van, or similar (up to 8 passengers)
text: For groups larger than 8, a minibus that takes up to 18 passengers can be provided.

listes.question: How Long Is The  Camel Ride ? What’s The Alternative Of Camels ?
text: The camel ride is 40 minutes to 1.5 hours long, depending on which camp you are staying in.
If you do not wish to do the camel ride, the camp has a 4x4 that takes people and luggage in and out of the camp, which you can use.
Alternatively, ATVs can be arranged at an additional cost.

listes.question: Dietary Perefences?
listes.repense: Please provide us with any dietary preferences you may have, and we will ensure that your needs are met. Kindly inform us of your preferences in advance so that we can make the necessary arrangements for lunch stops and notify the Riad/Camp accordingly, as some dinners are included in the package.

listes.question: What Happend To Your Laggage When You Do The Camel  Ride ?
text: During the Camel Ride, you will only take what's necessary for the ride.
The rest of your luggage will be transported to the camp's 4x4, and you will find it waiting for you at the camp.

listes.question: Pick-Up and Drop-Off Details ?
text: The pick-up can be either from the airport or your accommodation in Casablanca

At the end of the 7-day tour, we will drop you off at your hotel or riad in Marrakech, or the nearest available parking lot. The tour typically concludes between 5:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. in Marrakech, but the exact duration may vary depending on the time spent at each location.

listes.question: Is The  Tent Private ? Does It Have a Private Bathroom ?
listes.repense: The tent at the luxury camp is private and has private bathrooms with hot running water.

listes.question: Expenses ?
text: Currency Exchange: Euros or USD can be exchanged for Moroccan Dirham (MAD) at various locations throughout Morocco, including banks and currency exchange bureaus. Additionally, ATMs are widely available for cash withdrawals.
While credit cards and foreign currencies (Euros/USD) are generally accepted, it is advisable to carry local currency (MAD) for convenience and ease of transactions.
Meal Costs: Meals typically range from €5 to €20 per person, but prices may vary depending on the establishment.

Haggling / Price Negotiation: Haggling, or price negotiation, is an accepted practice in Morocco, and it is expected that customers will engage in this process. Many locations commonly participate in haggling.

tours.to: 5 Days Tour from Fes to Marrakech
tours.titre: 5 DAYS DESERT TOUR FROM FES TO MARRAKECH

about.paragraph1: 5 Days from Fes to Marrakech Morocco Tour Itinerary. In these 5 days / 4 nights you will visit so many fabulous places in a short time. The tour starts from Fes. Firstly, we will visit the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane, and the cedars forest. A stop in Midelt for lunch, then drive along the amazing Ziz river. After that we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Where you can ride camels, spend the night in a luxury camp in the middle of the desert. And also enjoy magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara. Furthermore you will visit Rissani traditional market and Erfoud the fossils town. Then visit the Todra gorges, Dades gorges and the various Kasbahs including Ait Ben Haddou and Amridil. Finally, cross the High Atlas mountains and the Tizi-n-Tichka pass. The tour ends in Marrakech.

programme.titre: ITINERARY : 5 DAYS FES TO MARRAKECH DESERT TOUR

jours.jour: 1st Day: Fes - Ifrane - Cedars forest - Midelt - Ziz valley - Merouga Sahara (7 Hours Drive)
text: The 5 days tour starts with an early pick up from the airport or your accommodation in Fes. Then we drive south through Imouzzer to visit Ifrane, famous for its low temperature, snow and the alpine-style houses – no wonder it is called the Switzerland of Morocco. Then we continue to the Cedars forest, where the Barbary Macaques live. Feel free to feed them while wandering in the forest. Later, we continue to Midelt, where lunch will be served. Then we head to the Sahara desert, driving through the Tizi-n-Tilghmt pass, and along the Ziz river.

In the afternoon we reach the Sahara desert of Merzouga, where you switch to camels and cross the sandy desert. A stop will be made for you to enjoy the magical sunset on top of a high dune. Then continue to the desert luxury camp, where you can enjoy the Berber drums music while dancing around the campfire, under the vast open sky of stars. Dinner and overnight in the camp.

jours.jour: 2nd Day : Explore Merzouga Region - Nomads - Kamlia - Merzouga Lake - Erg Chebbi - palm grove (3 Hours Drive)
text: Wake up early in the morning is a must do, in order to contemplate the beautiful sunrise, in the middle of the desert. Free time for breakfast. Then you return on camels to Merzouga, where the driver awaits. We dedicate the day to explore the region of Merzouga. The area has so many incredible sites, from sand dunes, wild lake, mines, fossils areas to fabulous oases. Which are ideal places for so many outdoor activities.

Firstly we start our journey in Merzouga, by driving off-road to visit an ancient eyeliner mine. Then we pay the nomads a visit, in their handmade woven tent. Learn how they live while drinking a Berber tea. Our next destination is the Khamlia village, where you will enjoy the Gnaoua music and dancing performances. Its inhabitants are originating from sub-Saharan countries like Mali, Sudan and Niger. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. After that we take a stroll in the palm trees grove. Then drive a few kilometres to see the wild lake of Merzouga, also called flamingos lake. Dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 3rd Day : Merzouga Sahara - Rissani - Erfoud - Todra Gorges - Dades Valley (5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani is still a major trading center in the region, with a large souk lively on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays.

After a stroll in Rissani Souk, we continue to Erfoud, where we visit one of the workshops of fossilized marble. Then we drive through Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves, to reach the Todra Gorges. The course of Todra river has carved out a grand canyon through the mountains — making a high red cliff-sided canyon. These gorges are an ideal place for rock climbers. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. Free time for lunch in a restaurant. Then we continue to the Dades Valley, through Boumalne Dades. Inevitable stops at the “monkey fingers” rock formation and on a spot atop a mountain overlooking the Dades Valley. Finally, dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 4th Day : Dades Valley - Roses Valley - Palm Gorves of Skoura - Ouarzazate (2.5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, we continue our trip to Kalaa Magouna to visit the Rose valley. A Rose Festival is held annually in May. Where the locals offer their rose products from perfumes, rose water, oil, to cosmetic products. Free time for lunch. We then drive through the palm groves of Skoura and visit the Kasbah of Amridil. Finally, we reach Ouarzazate, we visit the studios in which famous movies were shot, and also visit the Taourirt Kasbah. Dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 5th Day: Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah - High Atlas Mountains - Marrakech (3.5 Hours Drive)
text: On the last day, we depart to visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. A fortified village recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in many movies including Gladiator, Alexander, The Mummy...etc. And TV series including Game Of Thrones. Then we continue to Marrakech, by driving through the Tizi-N-Tichka pass, and the High Atlas Mountains. Stops will be made for lunch, and to take pictures at interesting spots. Finally, we drop you off at the airport or your accommodation in Marrakech. End of 5 days Fes to Marrakech desert tour.

listes.comment: One of the best tours we’ve ever booked. The guide was patient, funny, and very informative. The visit to Ait Ben Haddou was incredible!

tours.to: 6 Days Tour from Tangier to Marrakech
tours.titre: 6 DAYS TOUR FROM TANGIER TO MARRAKECH

about.paragraph1: 6 days tour from Tangier. During these 6 days /5 nights you will enjoy Morocco like never before with us. You will visit the most amazing places in Morocco. The tour starts in Tangier. Firstly, you will visit the Cape Spartel and also Hercules cave. Then you are going to cross the Rif mountains, stroll in the blue city of Chefchaouen, and also wander in the Roman ruins of Volubilis. The tour also includes Fes and Meknes Sightseeing. In addition to the visit of the Switzerland of Morocco Ifrane and Cedars forest. Ride camels and enjoy the magical sunset and sunrise in the Sahara desert of Merzouga. Walk in the magnificent Todra and Dades gorges. Visit historical Kasbahs, and cross the high Atlas mountains and the Tizi-n-Tichka pass. The tour ends in Marrakech.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY : 6 DAYS DESERT TOUR FROM TANGIER

jours.jour: 1st Day: Arrival in Tangier - Chefchaouen (2 Hours Drive)
text: On the first day of your 6-day tour from Tangier, we will pick you up from your accommodation, the airport, or the port in Tangier. Known as the Bride of the North, the city lies in the northwest, where the Mediterranean Sea meets the Atlantic Ocean near Cape Spartel. We will begin by exploring the city, including the Hercules Caves and Cape Spartel. You'll have free time for lunch. Then we drive inland to Chefchaouen via the city of Tetouan and the Rif Mountains, with stops for panoramic views. Overnight in a hotel in Chefchaouen.

the city lies in the northwest, where the Mediterranean Sea meets the Atlantic Ocean near Cape Spartel. We will begin by exploring the city, including the Hercules Caves and Cape Spartel. You'll have free time for lunch. Then we drive inland to Chefchaouen via the city of Tetouan and the Rif Mountains, with stops for panoramic views. Overnight in a hotel in Chefchaouen.

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Chefchaouen - Roman ruins of Volubilis - Meknes - Fes (4 Hours drive)
text: After breakfast, feel free to wander the beautiful alleyways of blue Chefchaouen. Then we drive to the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis, a UNESCO World Heritage Site renowned for its well-preserved mosaics, columns, and arches. After exploring the ruins, we drive about 30 km to Meknes, the Ismaili capital and one of Morocco's imperial cities, to visit Bab al-Mansour, the Sahrij Souani basin, the Royal Stables and granaries, and the Mausoleum of Moulay Ismail. We then continue to Fes. Overnight in a riad.

jours.jour: 3rd Day: Guided sightseeing in Fes (30min Drive / 2 to 3 hours walking tour)
text: We'll pick you up from your Riad in Fes after breakfast to begin your immersive exploration of one of Morocco's most iconic imperial cities, Fes, the country's cultural and spiritual heart.

Your journey starts with a driving tour. First, we'll stop at the magnificent Royal Palace Gate, followed by a visit to 'The Mellah', the historic Jewish Quarter. Then, enjoy breathtaking views from the Borj Sud fortress, offering a stunning overlook of the ancient Medina. The final stop of this portion is the Ceramic Village & School, where you'll witness traditional craftsmanship in action.

Next, a walking tour, step back in time as you enter the medieval Medina, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the best-preserved historic towns in the Arab world. Accompanied by a knowledgeable local guide, you'll explore highlights such as the Al Attarine Madrasa, the University and Mosque of Al Quaraouiyine considered the oldest existing university in the world, and the colorful Chouara Tanneries, where leather is dyed using centuries-old methods.
After this unforgettable journey through history, you'll be returned to your riad to relax.

jours.jour: 4th Day: Fes - Ifrane - Cedar Forest - Midelt - Ziz Valley - Merzouga Sahara (7 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, the 6-day Morocco tour from Tangier continues south through Imouzzer to visit Ifrane, famous for its cool climate, winter snow, and alpine-style houses – hence the nickname 'the Switzerland of Morocco'. We then continue to the Cedar Forest, home to wild Barbary macaques; enjoy a short walk among the ancient trees. Later, we continue to Midelt for free time at lunch, then drive over the Tizi-n-Talghamt Pass and along the Ziz Valley, with stops for panoramic views.

In the afternoon we reach the Sahara dunes of Merzouga, where you switch to camels and cross the sands, pausing atop a high dune to enjoy the sunset. Continue to your desert camp – a blend of traditional nomad tents and modern comforts – where you can enjoy Berber drumming around the campfire beneath a vast, star-filled sky. Overnight at a luxury desert camp in Merzouga.

jours.jour: 5th Day: Merzouga Sahara - Rissani - Erfoud - Todra Gorges - Dades Valley (5 Hours Drive)
text: Waking early to watch the sunrise is a must. After breakfast, we leave the desert for Rissani, the former capital of Tafilalet and a major trading center with a lively souk on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Sundays. Continue to Erfoud to visit a fossilized marble workshop.

We then drive through the palm groves of Touroug and Tinjdad to reach the Todra Gorges, where the Todra River has carved a spectacular canyon with towering red cliffs popular with rock climbers. Enjoy free time to wander the gorge and have lunch. In the afternoon, continue to the Dades Valley via Boumalne Dades, stopping at the “Monkey Fingers” rock formations and a scenic viewpoint over the valley. Dinner and overnight in a hotel.

jours.jour: 6th Day: Dades Valley - Roses Valley - Palm Groves of Skoura - Ouarzazate - Ait Benhaddou - High Atlas - Marrakech (5.5 Hours Drive)
text: After breakfast, the tour continues to Kelaat M'Gouna to visit the Valley of Roses. Each May, the Rose Festival showcases local products — rose water, essential oils, and cosmetics. We then drive through the palm groves of Skoura and reach Ouarzazate to tour the film studios.

We continue to the famous Kasbah of Ait Benhaddou, a UNESCO-listed fortified village featured in films such as Gladiator, Alexander, and The Mummy, as well as the series Game of Thrones. Afterwards, we visit the Telouet Kasbah and cross the High Atlas Mountains via the Tizi n'Tichka Pass, with stops for lunch and photos. Finally, we drop you at your accommodation (riad) in Marrakech. End of the 5 day tour.

listes.name: Sophie L. – France
listes.comment: Amazing 6-day tour! The guide was very knowledgeable, and the itinerary was perfectly planned. From the blue streets of Chefchaouen to the Sahara sunset, every moment was unforgettable.

listes.name: James K. – USA
listes.comment: Excellent experience! Loved the camel ride in Merzouga and the luxury desert camp. The High Atlas pass was breathtaking. Highly recommend this tour for anyone wanting a full Morocco experience.

listes.name: Amina B. – Morocco
listes.comment: The tour exceeded my expectations. Fes and Meknes sightseeing was fantastic, and the Todra & Dades gorges were stunning. Great private transport and comfortable hotels.

listes.name: Marc T. – Switzerland
listes.comment: Very well organized tour. The guide was friendly and informative. Loved visiting Ait Benhaddou and the Valley of Roses. A perfect mix of culture, adventure, and relaxation.

listes.question: Is The 6 Days Morocco Tour Private Or Shared ?
listes.repense: The six-day tour is a private experience, ensuring that only the travelers making the inquiry will be participating. No additional individuals will join the tour. Our primary focus is on providing high-quality, personalized experiences, which is why we mainly offer private tours.

listes.question: What Is The Best Time To Visit Morocco  ?
text: The best times to visit are spring (March-May) and autumn (September-November), when the weather is mild and pleasant across most regions.
Winter time is great as well, especially in the southern / Desert Part.

listes.question: Tour  Age  Suitabaility ?
listes.repense: This 6-day tour is suitable for individuals of all ages. However, please note that the tour involves approximately 1 to 7 hours of driving each day. While our vehicles are new and comfortable, and we make regular stops along the way, if you are not used to this level of travel, you may wish to consider a longer or customized tour.

listes.question: What Type Of Vehicles Are Used ?
listes.repense: The vehicle will be either an SUV (4x4) or a minivan, both with air conditioning. Vehicle Details:
listeRep: Minivans: Mercedes Vito Tourer, Ford Tourneo Van, or similar (up to 8 passengers)
text: For groups larger than 8, a minibus that takes up to 18 passengers can be provided.

listes.question: How Long Is The  Camel Ride ? What’s The Alternative Of Camels ?
text: The camel ride is 40 minutes to 1.5 hours long, depending on which camp you are staying in.
If you do not wish to do the camel ride, the camp has a 4x4 that takes people and luggage in and out of the camp, which you can use.
Alternatively, ATVs can be arranged at an additional cost.

listes.question: Dietary Perefences?
listes.repense: Please provide us with any dietary preferences you may have, and we will ensure that your needs are met. Kindly inform us of your preferences in advance so that we can make the necessary arrangements for lunch stops and notify the Riad/Camp accordingly, as some dinners are included in the package.

listes.question: What Happend To Your Laggage When You Do The Camel  Ride ?
text: During the Camel Ride, you will only take what's necessary for the ride.
The rest of your luggage will be transported to the camp's 4x4, and you will find it waiting for you at the camp.

listes.question: Pick-Up and Drop-Off Details ?
text: The pick-up can be either from the airport or your accommodation in Casablanca

At the end of the 7-day tour, we will drop you off at your hotel or riad in Marrakech, or the nearest available parking lot. The tour typically concludes between 5:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. in Marrakech, but the exact duration may vary depending on the time spent at each location.

listes.question: Is The  Tent Private ? Does It Have a Private Bathroom ?
listes.repense: The tent at the luxury camp is private and has private bathrooms with hot running water.

listes.question: Expenses ?
text: Currency Exchange: Euros or USD can be exchanged for Moroccan Dirham (MAD) at various locations throughout Morocco, including banks and currency exchange bureaus. Additionally, ATMs are widely available for cash withdrawals.
While credit cards and foreign currencies (Euros/USD) are generally accepted, it is advisable to carry local currency (MAD) for convenience and ease of transactions.
Meal Costs: Meals typically range from €5 to €20 per person, but prices may vary depending on the establishment.

Haggling / Price Negotiation: Haggling, or price negotiation, is an accepted practice in Morocco, and it is expected that customers will engage in this process. Many locations commonly participate in haggling.

tours.to: 4 Days Merzouga Desert Tour from Errachidia to Marrakech
tours.titre: 4 DAYS TOUR FROM ERRACHIDIA TO MARRAKECH

about.paragraph1: 4-day Merzouga desert tour from Errachidia. During these 4 days and 3 nights, you will explore the desert area. Visit the nomads in their tents, and enjoy the music of Gnawa and dance performances of the Khamlia people. After that, take a look at an old eyeliner mine and Merzouga Wildlife Lake, a few kilometers away. Then, stroll through the palm groves, ride camels, and enjoy the magical sunset and sunrise on the sand dunes. You will spend a night in a camp located in the middle of the Sahara Desert. Then, we visit the Dades Valley, Todra Gorge, and the Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou. We cross the High Atlas Mountains and the Tizi-n-Tichka pass. The tour ends in Marrakech.

programme.titre: MOROCCO ITINERARY : 4 DAYS DESERT TOUR FROM ERRACHIDIA

jours.jour: 1st Day: Arrival to Errachidia - Merzouga (2 Hours Drive)
text: On the first day of your 4-day Merzouga desert tour, we pick you up from Errachidia (ERH) Airport or your accommodation and drive south to the Sahara dunes of Merzouga. Overnight in Merzouga.
Flight options
listes: Domestic flights from Marrakech operate 3 days a week (Ryanair), arriving between 7:00 AM and 3:00 PM.
Domestic flights from Casablanca operate 7 days a week (Royal Air Maroc), arriving at midnight.

jours.jour: 2nd Day: Explore Merzouga - Nomads - Khamlia (Gnaoua village) - Merzouga Lake - Erg Chebbi - Palm Grove (2 Hours drive)
text: After breakfast, we dedicate the day to exploring the Merzouga Desert (Erg Chebbi). The area offers sand dunes, a seasonal wild lake, fossil sites, small mines, and beautiful oases—ideal for light outdoor activities.

We start with an off-road drive to an old kohl (eyeliner) mine, then visit nomads in their woven tents and learn about their way of life over a cup of Berber tea. Next, continue to Khamlia to enjoy Gnaoua music and dance; many residents have roots in Mali, Sudan, and Niger. Free time for lunch in a local restaurant. In the afternoon, stroll through a palm grove and drive a few kilometers to the wild lake of Merzouga (often called the flamingo lake).

Later, switch to camels to cross the dunes, stopping on a high dune for sunset, then continue to the luxury camp. Enjoy Berber drumming around the campfire under a sky full of stars. Dinner and overnight stay in the camp.

jours.jour: 3rd Day: Merzouga Sahara - Rissani - Erfoud - Todra Gorges - Dades Valley (5 Hours drive)
text: After breakfast, we leave the desert to visit Rissani town, the ancient capital of Tafilalet. Rissani remains a major trading center in the region, with a large souk bustling on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Sundays.

After a stroll through Rissani Souk, we continue to Erfoud, where we visit one of the fossilized marble workshops. Then we drive through Touroug and Tinjdad palm groves to reach the Todra Gorge. The Todra River has carved out a grand canyon through the mountains, creating a high, red, cliff-sided canyon. These gorges are an ideal place for rock climbers. Feel free to wander in the gorges and appreciate the beauty of the landscape. Free time for lunch at a restaurant. Then we continue to the Dades Valley, via Boumalne Dades. We make an inevitable stop at the 'Monkey Fingers' rock formation and at a spot atop a mountain overlooking the Dades Valley. Finally, dinner and overnight stay in a hotel.

jours.jour: 4th Day: Dades Valley - Rose Valley - Palm Groves of Skoura - Ouarzazate - Ait Ben Haddou Kasbah - High Atlas Mountains - Marrakech (5.5 Hours Drive)
text: On the last day of your 4-day desert tour, we continue our trip to Kalaa Magouna to visit the Rose Valley. A Rose Festival is held annually in May, where locals offer their rose products, from perfumes, rose water, and oil to cosmetics. We then drive through the palm groves of Skoura. Later, we reach Ouarzazate, also known as the gateway to the desert. We will visit the studios where famous movies were filmed.

We depart to visit the famous Kasbah of Ait Ben Haddou, a fortified village recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Furthermore, the Kasbah has appeared in many films, including Gladiator, Alexander, and The Mummy, as well as TV series such as Game of Thrones. Then we continue to Marrakech, driving through the Tizi-N-Tichka pass and the spectacular High Atlas Mountains. Stops will be made for lunch and to take pictures at interesting spots. Finally, we arrive in Marrakech and drop you off at the airport or your accommodation. (End of the tour)
